ex:

text:
good morning - i have a utility app instance on devnet which i needed to reconfigure with different IdP information (moving it to another okta instance), and as part of this move i also needed to change the sub of the user in Okta which is associated with the primary party

so prior to the move, i ran some REPL commands on the participant to create a new User with an id matching the sub of the new user, associated to the primary party ID, and then reconfigured everything in the helm chart with the new OIDC well known URL, new client IDs, new client secret for the API, all that stuff

after changing all of that and rolling everything, everything is up and running, and the regular wallet UI is fine - can log in with the new okta user and still see all the coins that were minted previously

however the utility app seems somewhat upset by the move - i can log in with this user, but it shows 0 CC and i can't do anything, so i have a feeling the utility app is persisting some part of the previous configuration in the database somewhere and is unhappy

where should i be looking to reconfigure things in the utility app or its database to get its view of the world to align with everything else again?

elements.text:
good morning - i have a utility app instance on devnet which i needed to reconfigure with different IdP information (moving it to another okta instance), and as part of this move i also needed to change the sub of the user in Okta which is associated with the primary party

so prior to the move, i ran some REPL commands on the participant to create a new User with an id matching the sub of the new user, associated to the primary party ID, and then reconfigured everything in the helm chart with the new OIDC well known URL, new client IDs, new client secret for the API, all that stuff

after changing all of that and rolling everything, everything is up and running, and the regular wallet UI is fine - can log in with the new okta user and still see all the coins that were minted previously

however the utility app seems somewhat upset by the move - i can log in with this user, but it shows 0 CC and i can't do anything, so i have a feeling the utility app is persisting some part of the previous configuration in the database somewhere and is unhappy

where should i be looking to reconfigure things in the utility app or its database to get its view of the world to align with everything else again?

text: Did you also grant can act as to the party for this new user id in the auth system?

elements.text: Did you also grant can act as to the party for this new user id in the auth system?

text:
I had a similar issue when moving auth system. For some reasons the wallet app works(the user did have right parimary_party) but the utility app won't.

After I grant "can act as that party for the user" then the utility works, even though the primary party match the "can act as party"

elements.text:
I had a similar issue when moving auth system. For some reasons the wallet app works(the user did have right parimary_party) but the utility app won't.

After I grant "can act as that party for the user" then the utility works, even though the primary party match the "can act as party"

text: <https://docs.digitalasset.com/build/3.3/reference/lapi-proto-docs.html#grantuserrights-method-version-com-daml-ledger-api-v2-admin> More specific this is what I do. It feels redundant because the primary_party of my user is the same as "can act as" but somehow it works on the utility after I did that.

text:
It feels absurb but it's so hard to craft manually.

I used this tool <https://github.com/fullstorydev/grpcui>

elements.text:
It feels absurb but it's so hard to craft manually.

I used this tool

text: ```grpcui -plaintext localhost:5001```

elements.text: grpcui -plaintext localhost:5001

text: think i found it in the canton REPL

elements.text: think i found it in the canton REPL

text: then you will be able to easily craft the payload

elements.text: then you will be able to easily craft the payload

text:
this did the trick:

```p.ledger_api.users.rights.grant("newuser", actAs=Set(p.parties.find("party-hint")))```

elements.text: this did the trick:
p.ledger_api.users.rights.grant("newuser", actAs=Set(p.parties.find("party-hint")))

text: thanks for the pointer!

elements.text: thanks for the pointer!
